docs.lead_paragraph: The mosquito-borne Zika virus spreading through the Americas, linked to severe birth defects in Brazil, will not be controlled over the long-term unless governments improve poor living conditions in the region's sprawling slums, experts say.

headline.main: Zika Fuelled by Rapid Urbanization, Poor Conditions in Latam's Slums-Experts
headline.print_headline: Zika Fuelled by Rapid Urbanization, Poor Conditions in Latam's Slums-Experts

docs.snippet: The mosquito-borne Zika virus spreading through the Americas, linked to severe birth defects in Brazil, will not be controlled over the long-term unless governments improve poor living conditions in the region's sprawling slums, experts say.

docs.lead_paragraph: Manipulating what kinds of bacteria live in the gut might lead to a new way to treat millions of children suffering chronic malnutrition, says new research that suggests the right microbes can help get the most out of a poor diet.

headline.main: Study: Right Gut Bacteria May Protect Against Malnutrition
headline.print_headline: Study: Right Gut Bacteria May Protect Against Malnutrition

docs.snippet: Manipulating what kinds of bacteria live in the gut might lead to a new way to treat millions of children suffering chronic malnutrition, says new research that suggests the right microbes can help get the most out of a poor diet.

headline.main: How Meditation Changes the Brain and Body

docs.abstract: A new study suggests there’s some science behind the claims made for mindfulness meditation.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests there’s some science behind the claims made for mindfulness meditation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Zika virus may be particularly adept at entrenching itself in parts of the body that are shielded from the immune system, making it harder to fight off and possibly lengthening the timeframe in which it can be transmitted, top U.S. experts said on Friday.

headline.main: Zika Virus May Hide in Organs Protected From the Immune System
headline.print_headline: Zika Virus May Hide in Organs Protected From the Immune System

docs.snippet: The Zika virus may be particularly adept at entrenching itself in parts of the body that are shielded from the immune system, making it harder to fight off and possibly lengthening the timeframe in which it can be transmitted, top U.S. experts said...

docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization says it may be necessary to use controversial methods like genetically modified mosquitoes to wipe out the insects that are spreading the Zika virus across the Americas.

headline.main: UN: Stopping Zika May Require Genetically Modified Insects
headline.print_headline: UN: Stopping Zika May Require Genetically Modified Insects

docs.snippet: The World Health Organization says it may be necessary to use controversial methods like genetically modified mosquitoes to wipe out the insects that are spreading the Zika virus across the Americas.

docs.lead_paragraph: Countries battling the Zika virus should consider new ways to curb disease-carrying mosquitoes, including testing the release of genetically modified insects and bacteria that stop their eggs hatching, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Genes, Bugs and Radiation: WHO Backs New Weapons in Zika Fight
headline.print_headline: Genes, Bugs and Radiation: WHO Backs New Weapons in Zika Fight

docs.snippet: Countries battling the Zika virus should consider new ways to curb disease-carrying mosquitoes, including testing the release of genetically modified insects and bacteria that stop their eggs hatching, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday.

docs.abstract: A battery of drugs, some new and some long known, have been proven to give addicts support in staying off drugs and alcohol after rehab.
docs.snippet: A battery of drugs, some new and some long known, have been proven to give addicts support in staying off drugs and alcohol after rehab.

docs.lead_paragraph: An advocate says, “Doctors and scientists have an ethical duty to explain to patients the implications of online data sharing” for research purposes.
docs.snippet: An advocate says, “Doctors and scientists have an ethical duty to explain to patients the implications of online data sharing” for research purposes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some patients avoid this specialty, which provides relief from pain and discomfort, because they mistake it for end-of-life care.

headline.main: In Palliative Care, Comfort Is the Top Priority

docs.abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age column examines resistance by many patients and their families to receiving palliative care because of its association with hospice care and eventuality of death; service, however, provides both pain relief and emotional and spiritual support, focuses on quality of life, and is often available in outpatient clinics.
docs.snippet: Some patients avoid this specialty, which provides relief from pain and discomfort, because they mistake it for end-of-life care.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama wants to visit Cuba, where, disease experts say, the arrival of the Zika virus is almost certain.

headline.main: Obama May Meet Zika Head On in Cuba
headline.print_headline: Obama May Meet Zika Peril Head On

docs.abstract: White House Letter; health experts are in agreement that Zika virus will inevitably reach Cuba and Peru, two countries Pres Obama is scheduled to visit in coming months; administration officials say that at this time no plans are being made to change president's itinerary based on the disease.
docs.snippet: President Obama wants to visit Cuba, where, disease experts say, the arrival of the Zika virus is almost certain.
